thread.title: Mitigating DDoS Attacks to Reduce Testing Outages

title: Mitigating DDoS Attacks to Reduce Testing Outages
text:
25 Mitigating DDoS Attacks to Reduce Testing Outages 
THE Journal: DDoS attacks are regularly launched on school systems to expose student records and hold information hostage. More often, DDoS attacks cause testing outages. Gary Bryant, technology coordinator at Augusta County Public Schools, shares his experience with a DDoS attack that threatened the district's technology center and impacted its online testing systems in a way that could have proved catastrophic.
